org.insomnia.rollit.shared.network

Class PacketSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.insomnia.rollit.shared.network.PacketSerializer

  • public final class PacketSerializer
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to simplify packet serialization.
    Author:
    ciske

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
      The default capacity in bytes of the underlying byte buffer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PacketSerializer()
      Creates a new packet serializer with the default capacity.
      PacketSerializer(int capacity)
      Creates a new packet serializer.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBoolean(boolean value)
      Serializes a boolean value to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addByte(byte value)
      Serializes a byte value to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addBytes(byte[] value)
      Serializes an array of bytes to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addBytes(byte[] value, int offset, int length)
      Serializes an array of bytes to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addChar(char value)
      Serializes a char value to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addDouble(double value)
      Serializes a double value to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addFloat(float value)
      Serializes a float value to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addInt(int value)
      Serializes an int value to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addLong(long value)
      Serializes a long value to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addShort(short value)
      Serializes a short value to the underlying byte buffer.
      void addString(java.lang.String value)
      Serializes a String value to the underlying byte buffer.
      byte[] array()
      Returns a copy of the underlying buffer from offset 0 and with length the current amount of bytes written.
      void clear()
      Resets the current amount of bytes written to 0 effectively resetting the serializer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PacketSerializer

        public PacketSerializer()
        Creates a new packet serializer with the default capacity.

      • PacketSerializer

        public PacketSerializer(int capacity)
        Creates a new packet serializer.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The capacity of the underlying byte buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • array

        public byte[] array()
        Returns a copy of the underlying buffer from offset 0 and with length the current amount of bytes written.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Resets the current amount of bytes written to 0 effectively resetting the serializer. Does not actually clears or reallocates the underlying byte buffer.

      • addBoolean

        public void addBoolean(boolean value)
        Serializes a boolean value to the underlying byte buffer. If the underlying byte buffer doesn't have enough free room it is expanded to ensure enough room is available.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to serialize.

      • addByte

        public void addByte(byte value)
        Serializes a byte value to the underlying byte buffer. If the underlying byte buffer doesn't have enough free room it is expanded to ensure enough room is available.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to serialize.

      • addShort

        public void addShort(short value)
        Serializes a short value to the underlying byte buffer. If the underlying byte buffer doesn't have enough free room it is expanded to ensure enough room is available.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to serialize.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to serialize.

      • addBytes

        public void addBytes(byte[] value)
        Serializes an array of bytes to the underlying byte buffer. If the underlying byte buffer doesn't have enough free room it is expanded to ensure enough room is available.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to serialize.

      • addBytes

        public void addBytes(byte[] value,
            int offset,
            int length)
        Serializes an array of bytes to the underlying byte buffer. If the underlying byte buffer doesn't have enough free room it is expanded to ensure enough room is available.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to serialize.
        offset - The offset within the value to start from.
        length - The amount of bytes to serialize from the value.
